poem:
"Bounds Etched in Impermanence"

Court's gavel, a quiet thunder,
haunts the morningordial order.
Lines on the map - not right, nor fair,
Blind eyes see not the Black despair.

Yet, silent seeds in the heart of dirt,
Taste not the bitterness of hurt.
Rise, they will, beneath the sun,
Their battle not yet lost, nor won.
